column3: Huh, that check is indeed strange. ACK on removing it.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/0b78ba8ad69d55817f2b62c631a71b5ac32549f1 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
!AppInit() is fine also, but keeping the conditional expression reminders reader about the value type: AppInit() returns a bool while main() returns an int.  Just my 2 cents.\n

@4tar yeah - I think it makes some sense to enumerate the values here, as the RPC client can return other exit codes than 0 and 1 (which it does directly in AppInit() through exit(), which is damn ugly, but RPC client functionality is going to be removed from bitcoind anyway).\n
